Great Minds. One Goal. Canada's Success.
     
     
    Help bring research to life and drive your career forward with the National Research Council of Canada (NRC), Canada's largest research and technology organization.
     
     
    We are looking for a Technical Officer, Instrumentation Support to support the Ocean, Coastal and River Engineering (OCRE) Research Centre. The selected candidate would be someone who shares our core values Integrity, Excellence, Respect and Creativity.
     
     Do you want to be part of a team working to find solutions to protect infrastructure, property and people from severe weather events and other environmental risks while also meeting the challenges of climate change?
     
     At OCRE, the researchers are using physical modelling techniques to find real world solutions to ongoing challenges present in the natural world. The primary purpose of the position is to provide electronic technical support services in installing, maintaining, troubleshooting and calibrating laboratory instrumentation of various physical model experiments. The incumbent should be able to design, build electronic equipment and install and maintain data acquisition equipment in support of the laboratory physical model experiments. Upon completion of the experimental setup the employee ensures the continuous operation of the instrumentation throughout the project. The employee may be asked to coordinate or assist with the production of technical reports and users’ manuals. The incumbent will also be involved in the regular maintenance, upgrade and development of OCRE’s testing facilities instrumentation.
     
     NRC’s main campus on Montreal Road offers free parking and easy access for runners, walkers and in-line skaters to break away during the day and enjoy the beautiful surroundings. Most buildings have shower and locker facilities, in addition to an on-campus Fitness Centre. There are also areas for soccer, volleyball and even beach volleyball during the summer! There are ample picnic areas and easy access to a shopping centre, grocery store and pharmacy, as well as numerous restaurants. 
   
  
  
   
     Screening Criteria 
   
   
     Applicants must demonstrate within the content of their application that they meet the following screening criteria in order to be given further consideration as candidates: 
   
  
  
   
     Education 
   
   
     Completion of post-secondary education in an electronic engineering/technology program or other technical, engineering or scientific discipline related to the position, or equivalent combination of work-related experience, training and education.
     
     
    For information on certificates and diplomas issued abroad, please see Degree equivalency 
   
  
  
   
     Experience 
   
   
    
     Recent experience in providing electronic technical expertise by installing, maintaining, troubleshooting, and calibrating laboratory instrumentation; 
     Experience in installing and maintaining data acquisition equipment for support of laboratory physical model studies; 
     Experience in providing programming assistance for ongoing laboratory real-time software development including programming and interfacing data acquisition hardware and control systems. 
     Experience in using computers to analyze data, and present test results. 
     Experience in working in a multidisciplinary team environment. 
     Experience operating machinery such as skid steers and/or forklift would be an asset. 
    
   
  
  
   
    Condition of Employment 
   
   
     Secret (II) 
   
  
  
   
     Language Requirements 
   
   
     English
     
     
    Information on language requirements and self-assessment tests 
   
  
  
   
     Assessment Criteria 
   
   
     Candidates will be assessed on the basis of the following criteria: 
   
  
  
   
     Technical Competencies 
   
   
    
     Ability to work independently, and with others, under the general guidance of project engineers to meet objectives and deadlines 
     Ability to use computers and research laboratory instrumentation devices and their application, set-up, calibration, and use for control of facilities and equipment, for data acquisition, analysis and processing. 
     Ability in the application, use, and interpretation of results from instruments and gauges for measuring wave heights, flows, displacements, accelerations, and other physical quantities. 
     Knowledge of preparation of calibration reports and operational procedures 
     Ability to apply reading and interpretation skills to review technical drawings, instructions and specifications. 
     Knowledge of Occupational Health & Safety regulations and legislation required to create and maintain a safe and healthy environment. 
     Ability to work with CAD software (AutoCAD, Solid Works) considered an asset. 
    
   
  
  
   
    Behavioural Competencies 
   
   
    Technology support - Communication (Level 2) 
    Technology support - Conceptual and analytical ability (Level 2) 
    Technology support - Results orientation (Level 2) 
    Technology support - Self-knowing and self-development (Level 2) 
    Technology support - Teamwork (Level 2) 
   
  
  
   
    Competency Profile(s) 
   
   
     For this position, the NRC will evaluate candidates using the following competency profile: Technology Support
     
     
   
  
  
   
     Compensation 
   
   
     Salary under review.
     
     
    From $58,445 to $80,040 per annum.
     
     
    NRC employees enjoy a wide-range of competitive benefits including comprehensive health and dental plans, vacation, sick, and other leave entitlements, disability insurance and pension plans. 
   
  
  
   
     The NRC Advantage 
   
   
     The National Research Council of Canada (NRC) is the Government of Canada's largest research organization supporting industrial innovation, the advancement of knowledge and technology development. We collaborate with over 70 colleges, universities and hospitals annually, work with 800 companies on their projects, and provide advice or funding to over 8000 Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) each year.
     
     
    We bring together the brightest minds to deliver tangible impacts on the lives of Canadians and people around the world. And now, we want to partner with you. Let your expertise and inspirations make an impact by joining the NRC.
     
     
    At the NRC Employee wellness matters. We offer flexible work schedules as well as part-time work to help employees maintain work-life balance. We are one of the few federal organizations that close our offices during the December holiday season. We offer professional learning and development opportunities such as conferences, workshops, and a suite of mentorship, award and recognition programs. Diversity enables creativity and innovation. Fostering a diverse, inclusive, welcoming and supportive workplace is important to us, and contributes to a more inclusive Canadian innovation system. We welcome all qualified applicants and encourage you to complete the employment equity self-declaration questions during the job application process. Please let us know of any accommodation measures required to help you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Please note that the information you provide will be treated confidentially.
     
     
    Help us solve problems for Canada. Grow your career with us today! 
   
  
  
   
     Notes 
   
   
    
     Relocation assistance will be determined in accordance with the NRC's directives. 
     Overtime will sometimes be required. 
     Work typically requires daily intermittent periods of standing, walking and sitting at a work bench; working in awkward positions; bending and stretching; moving lightweight objects and large, awkward and heavier objects on occasion; operating hand and power tools and forklifts; climbing stairs and ladders on occasion. 
     Work is typically performed in a laboratory, plant or shop environment that includes daily exposure to background noise from tools and equipment, and regular exposure to chemicals, dirt, noise, noxious odors, hazardous equipment and substances, extreme temperatures or other awkward conditions. Work can be performed indoors and outdoors, extreme weather conditions, and working on uneven terrain and from heights. 
     A pre-qualified list may be established for similar positions for a one year period. 
     Preference will be given to Canadian Citizens and Permanent Residents of Canada. Please include citizenship information in your application. 
     The incumbent must adhere to safe workplace practices at all times. 
     We thank all those who apply, however only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
    
   
  
 
  
  
 Please direct your questions, with the requisition number (19859) to: 
 E-mail: NRC.NRCHiring-EmbaucheCNRC.CNRC@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca 
 Telephone: 343-550-0290 
 Closing Date: 19 January 2024 - 23:59 Eastern Time

positionName: Administrative Assistant, Ambulatory Care, Temporary Full Time (1.0)
description:
Compensation Pay Range:
  $29.35-$36.05
 
 
   Job Description:
 
 
   Please Note: If you are a current CHEO employee with access to Workday, please apply to this posting via the Workday application as an internal applicant using the Jobs Hub.
 
 
 
   To successfully apply for this position, please submit your application by 11:59 pm the day before the advertised closing date in the posting to ensure your application is received.
 
 
 
   POSITION SUMMARY
 
 
   The Administrative Coordinator coordinates the provision of administrative and clerical support while ensuring confidentiality and efficient conduct of business through the office. The Administrative Coordinator provides administrative support to the Director of the Regional Genetics Program, the Chief of the Department of Genetics and the Program Director of the Genetics Residency Program
 
 
 
   MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
 
 
  
   
     Oversee work of other support staff as well as provide input into their performance appraisals and manage their schedules, coverage plans and vacation requests
   
  
   
     Coordinate the process related to recruitment/selection, performance appraisal and attendance enhancement including all relevant HR documentation
   
  
   
     Enter staff rotations and hours into StaffRight system (including requests for leave, vacation, sick time, professional development, etc.)
   
  
   
     Be aware of the Collective Agreements of the different Unions
   
  
   
     Prepare documentation for expense requests, professional development travel claims including ensuring all relevant signatures are obtained
   
  
   
     Process mileage claims for PSU staff
   
  
   
     Prepare requisitions
   
  
   
     Type/transcribe correspondence and format electronically based reports and correspondence; prepare spreadsheets; prepare presentations in PowerPoint, prepare documents for review.
   
  
   
     Prepare and send responses on routine correspondence; collate information and draft updates to reports and other documents;
   
  
   
     Review correspondence and/or reports for Director Signature and ensure appropriate grammar, completeness and accuracy.
   
  
   
     Analyse and prioritize incoming mail and documents, distribute appropriately.
   
  
   
     Receive and screen incoming calls, assess the urgency of calls, provide information as required to the caller, or refer the caller to the appropriate person.
   
  
   
     Prepare draft agendas for meetings, transcribe and distribute minutes. Ensure appropriate follow up action on items as required.
   
  
   
     Maintain calendar and schedule meetings, appointments and/or events; prepare necessary documentation for meetings, appointments and/or events; reschedule meetings, appointments or events based on availability to avoid conflict with competing and changing priorities.
   
  
   
     Make arrangements for meetings; schedule board and conference rooms, arrange or confirm attendance, prepare material and co-ordinate catering.
   
  
   
     Make travel and hotel arrangements for staff and visitor (e.g. visiting speakers, and prepare travel claims as required.
   
  
   
     Establish, develop and maintain various internal office support systems such as electronic databases, tracking systems, filing systems, monthly reports, BF systems, and confidential files.
   
  
   
     Supervise the ordering of office supplies as required
   
  
   
     Act as Program Administrator for the Genetics Residency Program.
   
  
   
     Maintain and update the Genetics pages on CHEOnet
   
  
   
     Act as the liaison for updates to the Genetics information posted on the CHEO website
   
  
   
     Perform other duties as assigned.
   
 
 
 
   QUALIFICATIONS
 
 
  
   
     Criminal Records Check (Essential)
   
  
   
     College Diploma in Office Administration and/or University Degree. (Experience and formal training combined with demonstrated performance and ability may substitute for stipulated academic requirements.) (Essential)
   
  
   
     Minimum of three (3) years of relevant experience including experience in a more responsible administrative assistant role, including office management functions and/or previous supervisory experience. (Essential)
   
  
   
     Comprehensive use of software including word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, electronic mail. (Essential)
   
  
   
     Take accurate notes or minutes of meetings and transcribe to final product. (Essential)
   
  
   
     Use a voicemail system, photocopier, fax machine and scanner (Essential)
   
  
   
     Take steps to ensure timely completion of tasks by adjusting priorities as required. (Essential)
   
  
   
     Adapt to changes to meet organizational requirements. (Essential)
   
  
   
     Communicate effectively and concisely, both orally and in writing. (Essential)
   
  
   
     Research, collate, analyze and/or summarize information (Essential)
   
  
   
     Work independently (Essential)
   
  
   
     Deal effectively with internal and external customers (Essential)
   
  
   
     Exercise sound judgement, discretion and a high degree of confidentiality. (Essential)
   
  
   
     Bilingualism (French / English) (Preferred)
   
 
 
 
   Effective March 29, 2021, CHEO will conduct a more comprehensive pre-screening and evaluation process. This process may include more varied and multidimensional testing such as a written test, practical exam, or other assessment. All candidates who meet the essential and preferred qualifications may be tested.
 
 
 
   CHEO values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process and welcome interest from all qualified applicants.
 
 
 
   Should you require accommodation during any phase in the recruitment process, please contact Human Resources at 
  
   jobs@cheo.on.ca
  . All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential and will be handled in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.
 
 
 
   We thank all those who apply, however, only those to be interviewed will be contacted.
 
 
   Bilingualism (French/English) will be validated by a language proficiency assessment conducted by a third party provider. Candidates will be required to meet the minimum linguistic profile prior to the date of hire.
 
 
 
   CHEO is committed to providing a safe environment for staff, patients, and visitors. Consistent with that commitment, all applicants must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to be considered for any staff or volunteer opportunities. Applicants are also strongly encouraged to receive their COVID-19 booster shots when eligible to protect against the spread of COVID-19. Upon hiring, presentation of government issued documentation confirming full vaccination must be provided, or presentation of supporting documentation of a valid medical contraindication or other reasonable consideration pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code..
 
 
 
   Veuillez noter : si vous êtes actuellement un employé du CHEO ayant accès à Workday, veuillez postuler à cette offre via l'application Workday en tant que candidat interne.
 
 
 
   Veuillez noter : pour postuler avec succès à ce poste, veuillez soumettre votre candidature avant 23 h 59 la veille de la date de clôture annoncée dans l'affichage pour vous assurer que votre candidature est reçue.
 
 
 
   RÉSUMÉ DES FONCTIONS
 
 
   Le ou la titulaire devra coordonner la prestation des services de soutien à l’administration et au secrétariat; veiller à ce que les fonctions administratives du bureau soient effectuées avec efficacité et confidentialité; agir à titre de soutien administratif pour la directrice du Programme régional de génétique, la chef du Service de génétique et la directrice du programme de résidence en génétique.
 
 
 
   RESPONSABILITÉS PRINCIPALES
 
 
  
   
     Superviser le travail des autres membres du personnel de soutien, contribuer à l’évaluation de leur rendement et gérer leur emploi du temps, les plans de remplacement et les demandes de vacances ;
   
  
   
     Coordonner le processus lié au recrutement/à la sélection, à l’évaluation du rendement et à l’amélioration de l’assiduité, y compris toute la documentation pertinente des RH ;
   
  
   
     Saisir les rotations et les heures du personnel dans le système StaffRight (notamment les demandes de congés, de vacances, de congés de maladie, de perfectionnement professionnel, etc.) ;
   
  
   
     Être au fait des conventions collectives des différents syndicats.
   
  
   
     Préparer les réquisitions pour les demandes de dépenses du personnel, les demandes de remboursement pour dépense de voyage dans le cadre de la formation continue et obtenir les signatures requises.
   
  
   
     Procéder aux demandes de remboursement de kilométrage pour le personnel de l’Unité.
   
  
   
     Préparer les réquisitions.
   
  
   
     Taper/transcrire la correspondance et mettre sous format électronique approprié les rapports et la correspondance; préparer les feuilles de calculs; préparer les présentations en Powerpoint, préparer les documents aux fins de révision.
   
  
   
     Préparer et envoyer les réponses à la correspondance de routine; colliger les renseignements et rédiger l’ébauche des mises à jour des rapports et d’autres documents.
   
  
   
     Revoir la correspondance et/ou les rapports avant de les donner à signer à la directrice et veiller à la correction grammaticale des textes. Vérifier s’ils sont complets et exacts.
   
  
   
     Analyser et décider de la priorité du courrier et des documents et les distribuer à qui de droit.
   
  
   
     Répondre aux appels téléphoniques et les filtrer en évaluant leur degré d’urgence, en donnant les renseignements demandés ou en les aiguillant vers la personne concernée.
   
  
   
     Préparer les ordres du jour provisoires des réunions, puis prendre des notes, rédiger et distribuer les procès-verbaux. Veiller à ce que les suivis soient dûment effectués.
   
  
   
     Tenir à jour le calendrier et l’horaire des réunions, des rendez-vous et des événements spéciaux; préparer la documentation nécessaire pour les réunions, rendez-vous et événements divers; changer les horaires en fonction des disponibilités des participants et afin d’éviter les conflits avec d’autres priorités ou en fonction des changements de priorités.
   
  
   
     Organiser des réunions, réserver des salles de réunion et de conférence, inviter et inscrire les participants, confirmer leur présence, préparer des documents et coordonner les services de restauration.
   
  
   
     Organiser les déplacements et réserver les chambres d’hôtel pour le personnel ; préparer les demandes de remboursement des dépenses selon les besoins.
   
  
   
     Établir, développer et entretenir divers systèmes internes de soutien du bureau tels que des bases de données, des systèmes de suivi, des systèmes de classement des dossiers, des rapports mensuels, des systèmes de rappel ainsi que des dossiers confidentiels.
   
  
   
     Superviser les commandes de fournitures de bureau selon les besoins.
   
  
   
     Administrer le programme de résidence en génétique.
   
  
   
     Tenir à jour les pages de CHEONet relatives à la génétique.
   
  
   
     Agir à titre de liaison pour les mises à jour de l’information sur la génétique affichées sur le site web du CHEO.
   
  
   
     Accomplir d’autres tâches à la demande de la superviseure.
   
 
 
 
   QUALIFICATIONS
 
 
  
   
     Vérification du casier judiciaire (VCJ) (Essentiel)
   
  
   
     Diplôme en administration de bureau et/ou diplôme universitaire. On envisagera d’accepter un degré d’expérience et de formation officielle alliés à des capacités et un rendement manifestes au lieu des études exigées ci-contre. (Essentiel)
   
  
   
     Avoir une expérience pertinente d’au moins trois (3) années, notamment à assumer de plus en plus de responsabilités comme adjoint administratif, y compris des fonctions de gestion de bureau et/ou une expérience antérieure en supervision. (Essentiel)
   
  
   
     Maîtrise de logiciels, y compris traitement de texte, tableur, présentation et courrier électronique. (Essentiel)
   
  
   
     Prendre des notes précises ou rédiger des procès-verbaux de réunions et les transcrire sous forme de produit final. (Essentiel)
   
  
   
     Utiliser un système de messagerie vocale, une photocopieuse, un télécopieur et un numériseur (Essentiel)
   
  
   
     Prendre des mesures pour assurer l’accomplissement des tâches en temps opportun en ajustant les priorités selon les besoins (Essentiel)
   
  
   
     S’adapter aux changements pour répondre aux exigences de l’organisation (Essentiel)
   
  
   
     Communiquer de manière efficace et concise, à l’oral comme à l’écrit (Essentiel)
   
  
   
     Rechercher, rassembler, analyser et/ou résumer des informations (Essentiel)
   
  
   
     Travailler de manière autonome (Essentiel)
   
  
   
     Bilinguisme (français et anglais) (Préférable)
   
 
 
 
   À partir du 29 mars 2021, CHEO mènera un processus de présélection et d'évaluation plus complet. Ce processus peut comprendre des tests plus variés et multidimensionnels tels qu'un test écrit, un examen pratique ou une autre évaluation. Tous les candidats qui satisfont aux qualifications essentielles et préférées peuvent être testés.
 
 
 
   CHEO valorise la diversité et est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès. Nous nous sommes engagés à fournir un environnement de travail inclusif et sans obstacle, en commençant par le processus d’embauche et nous sommes heureux de recevoir des demandes provenant de tous les candidats qualifiés.
 
 
   Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation pendant une phase du processus de recrutement, veuillez communiquer avec les Ressources humaines à 
  
   jobs@cheo.on.ca
  . Tous les renseignements reçus concernant les mesures d’adaptation resteront confidentiels et seront traités conformément à la 
  Loi sur l’accessibilité pour les personnes handicapées de l’Ontario.
 
 
   Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui posent leur candidature; toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec celles qui seront convoquées à une entrevue.
 
 
   La validation du bilinguisme (français-anglais) se fera au moyen d’une évaluation des compétences linguistiques menée par un fournisseur externe. Les candidats devront satisfaire au profil linguistique minimum de leur poste avant la date d’embauche.
 
 
 
   CHEO s’engage à offrir un environnement sécuritaire au personnel, aux patients et aux visiteurs. Conformément à cet engagement, tous les candidats doivent être entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 pour être considérés comme des candidats pour tout emploi de personnel ou de bénévole. Les candidats sont également fortement encouragés à recevoir leurs doses de rappel contre la COVID-19 lorsqu’ils sont admissibles pour éviter la propagation de COVID-19. Lors de l’embauche, la présentation de documents gouvernementaux confirmant la vaccination complète doit être fournie, ou la présentation de documents justificatifs d’une contre-indication médicale valide ou d’une autre considération raisonnable en vertu du Code des droits de la personne de l’Ontario.
 
 
 
   CHEO values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process and welcome interest from all qualified applicants.
 
 
 
   Should you require accommodation during any phase in the recruitment process, please contact Human Resources at jobs@cheo.on.ca. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential and will be handled in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.
 
 
 
   We thank all those who apply, however, only those to be interviewed will be contacted.
 
 
 
   Job Posting End Date (if applicable):
  January 8, 2024

positionName: Spécialiste du traitement de la paie bilingue
description:
C'est chez nous que les professionnels sont les plus productifs et les plus heureux au travail. Voilà l'unique objectif d'ADP. Parce que tout ce que nous faisons tourne autour des gens. En commençant par les nôtres. Nous sommes ouverts aux nouvelles idées. Celles de personnes qui voient grand et qui exigent davantage de leur carrière. Des personnes qui aspirent à un travail épanouissant et à une vie de famille en synergie avec leurs besoins
  . 
  
  
 Les services complets d'ADP:
  
  ADP Canada et ADP Comprehensive Services aux États-Unis se sont associées pour lancer au Canada une entreprise d'impartition des processus d'affaires au cours de l'exercice 2015. Cette entreprise tire avantage du modèle commercial d'ADP Comprehensive Services, l'organisation qui connaît la croissance la plus rapide en matière de comptes principaux. Si vous désirez contribuer à la progression d'un nouveau modèle d'affaires et participer aux processus de développement, et êtes en quête d'une excellente occasion de croissance, cette offre d'emploi pourrait vous intéresser.
  
  
 Sommaire du poste:
  
  ADP est à la recherche d'un 
 spécialiste du traitement de la paie. Le titulaire de ce poste aidera les clients à tirer profit des solutions exceptionnelles d'ADP en matière de paie, de sorte qu'ils puissent se concentrer sur ce qui compte le plus pour eux : la croissance de leur entreprise.
  
  
 Responsabilités:
  
 
  Assumer la responsabilité et l'imputabilité relativement à la fonction de traitement et de vérification de la paie, et ce, pour plusieurs clients. 
  Prioriser et traiter la paie des clients qui lui attribués en suivant le processus en place. 
  Effectuer promptement la mise à jour complète et précise des dossiers des clients et de leurs employés en temps réel. 
  Tenir à jour des notes complètes et précises relatives aux profils des clients et leurs instructions pour le traitement de leur paie. 
  Auditer la paie des clients selon le calendrier de fin d'année et effectuer toutes les remises aux tiers avant les dates d'échéance établies, transmettre les données électroniquement et générer les relevés pour ces clients. 
  Utiliser tous les outils et processus internes afin d'optimiser la productivité et assurer l'excellence du service; recommander les meilleures pratiques aux clients. 
  Recevoir des appels de clients (clients attribués ou autres). 
  Effectuer les vérifications trimestrielles et de fin d'exercice, notamment la conciliation de fin d'année, les ajustements et la distribution des feuillets T4/R1. 
  Fournir aux clients les renseignements essentiels et exacts selon la réglementation en vigueur à propos de la paie, notamment la déclaration de revenus. Utiliser les diverses bases de données, les ressources documentaires, de même que les sites Web appropriés pour trouver les réponses et solutions appropriées aux problèmes des clients. 
  Travailler en collaboration avec l'équipe de soutien technique interne et les différents centres de d'ADP, au besoin, afin de trouver une solution. 
 
 
  Travailler à l'amélioration continue relativement aux produits, aux problèmes, aux processus et aux procédures en communiquant ses observations et suggestions et ainsi, accroître l'efficacité. 
  Maintenir son titre auprès de l'ACP (Association canadienne de la paie) et participer à toutes les formations exigées par le service et mettre en application ses apprentissages dans le cadre de ses fonctions. 
 
  
 Qualifications requises:
  
 
  Minimum deux années d'expérience en traitement de la paie 
  Deux années d'expérience administrative en service à la clientèle/RH 
  Connaissance des produits d'ADP, un atout 
  Bonne maîtrise de MS Office (Word/Excel) et Internet requise 
  Compétences supérieures en service à la clientèle, à l'écrit et à l'oral, et bonnes compétences en écoute active. 
  Excellentes compétences en communication 
  Capacité à collaborer et à travailler efficacement au sein d'équipes interfonctionnelles 
  Excellentes compétences en gestion du temps et aptitude à respecter les échéances 
  Très bonne maitrise du français et de l'anglais 
 
  
 Scolarité:
  
 
  Baccalauréat/certificat, un atout, ou l'équivalent en matière d'expérience administrative en service à la clientèle/RH. 
  Certification de l'ACP (Association Canadienne de la Paie) : un atout 
 
  
  NOTE À L'INTENTION DES CANDIDATS:
  
  Veuillez prendre note que toute offre d'emploi est conditionnelle à une vérification des antécédents, y compris la vérification du casier judiciaire.
  
  Nous créons une façon de travailler plus efficace, afin que vous puissiez atteindre vos objectifs. Fréquemment désignée comme l'une des " sociétés les plus admirées " par le magazine FORTUNE®, et reconnue par DiversityInc® comme l'une des 50 meilleures entreprises en matière de diversité, ADP collabore avec plus de 740 000 entreprises à l'échelle mondiale afin d'aider leurs employés à travailler plus intelligemment, à relever de nouveaux défis et à déployer leur talent. " Axer le développement sur les personnes " signifie que nous créons des plateformes qui transformeront le monde du travail, nous permettant ensemble de découvrir d'infinies possibilités.
  
  At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, or protected veteran status. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.

Compensation Pay Range:
 
  $21.83-$26.83
 
 
   Job Description:
 
 
  
   
     Please Note: If you are a current CHEO employee with access to Workday, please apply to this posting via the Workday application as an internal applicant.
   
   
   
     To successfully apply for this position, please submit your application by 11:59 pm the day before the advertised closing date in the posting to ensure your application is received.
   
   
   
     POSITION SUMMARY
   
   
   
     Provides clerical support services, ensures confidentiality and efficient conduct of business through the pharmacy department.
   
   
   
     RESPONSIBILITIES
   
   
     Greet CHEO employees, visitors, patients and their families, identify the need and the urgency of the requests, provide information as required and notify the appropriate person to ensure the smooth functioning of the pharmacy reception area.
     Receive and screen incoming calls to the pharmacy department, assess the urgency of the calls, provide information as required to the caller, take messages or refer the caller to the appropriate person.
     Liaise with staff and coordinate retrieval of internal responses for matters requiring a reply.
     Maintain continuous personal awareness of the Departments activities to interpret and direct for disposition, inquiries and directives from other services and the public by providing assistance and required information verbally and/or in writing.
     Deliver medications within Pharmacy department, kidcare, and to the clinical ward in a timely and appropriate manner.
     Provide support to the pharmacy staff on pharmacy non-regulated tasks.
     Scan all paper files to patient chart.
     Maintain files and order supplies as required within the areas of the department.
     Photocopy, collate, fax and distribute documents. Proofread documents for grammar and spelling.
     Type, transcribe dictated correspondence and format electronically based reports and correspondence; prepare spreadsheets; prepare documents for review.
     Analyse and prioritize incoming mail and documents; distribute appropriately.
     Establish, develop, and maintain various internal office support systems such as electronic databases, tracking systems, filing systems, monthly reports, BF systems, and confidential files.
     Participate in staff and pharmacy technician meetings, departmental planning and communication activities, and special project assignments as required.
     Participate in pharmacy quality assurance activities.
     Keep work areas clean, organized, and functional.
     Work cooperatively with all colleagues, promoting and maintaining harmonious inter and intra departmental relationships
     Perform other duties as assigned.
   
   
   
     QUALIFICATIONS
   
   
     Police Record Check (PRC) (Essential)
     High School Diploma (Essential)
     Minimum six (6) months of related experience (Essential)
     Comprehensively use software including wordprocessing, spreadsheet, presentation, electronic mail.(Essential)
     Use a voicemail system, photocopier, complex use of fax machine. (Essential)
     Take steps to ensure timely completion of tasks by adjusting priorities as required. (Essential)
     Adapt to changes to meet requirements. (Essential)
     Communicate effectively and concisely, both orally and in writing. (Essential)
     Work independently (Essential)
     Research, collate, analyze and/or summarize information. (Essential)
     Deal effectively with internal and external customers. (Essential)
     Exercise sound judgement, discretion and a high degree of confidentiality. (Essential)
     Bilingual (English/French) (Preferred)
   
   
   
    Please note you will be represented by the Ontario Federation Healthcare Workers – Laborers International Union of North America , (OFHCW-LiUNA).
   
   
   
     CHEO is committed to providing a safe environment for staff, patients, and visitors. Consistent with that commitment, all applicants must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to be considered for any staff or volunteer opportunities. Applicants are also strongly encouraged to receive their COVID-19 booster shots when eligible to protect against the spread of COVID-19. Upon hiring, presentation of government issued documentation confirming full vaccination must be provided, or presentation of supporting documentation of a valid medical contraindication or other reasonable consideration pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.
   
   
   
     CHEO values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process and welcome interest from all qualified applicants.
   
   
   
     Should you require accommodation during any phase in the recruitment process, please contact Human Resources at 
    
     jobs@cheo.on.ca
    . All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential and will be handled in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.
   
   
   
     We thank all those who apply, however, only those to be interviewed will be contacted.
   
   
   
     Veuillez noter : Si vous êtes un employé actuel de CHEO et que vous avez accès à Workday, veuillez postuler à cette offre par l’entremise de l’application Workday à titre de candidat interne.
   
   
   
     Pour postuler avec succès à ce poste, veuillez soumettre votre candidature avant 23 h 59 le jour précédant la date de clôture annoncée dans l’annonce afin de vous assurer que votre candidature sera bien reçue.
   
   
   
     RÉSUMÉ DES FONCTIONS
   
   
   
     Le ou la titulaire fournit des services de soutien administratif et veille à la confidentialité et au fonctionnement efficace des affaires dans tout le service de pharmacie.
   
   
   
     RESPONSABILITÉS
   
   
     Accueillir les employés de CHEO, les visiteurs, les patients et leurs familles, établir le besoin et l’urgence des demandes, fournir l’information au besoin et aviser la personne appropriée afin d’assurer le bon fonctionnement de l’aire de réception de la pharmacie.
     Recevoir et filtrer les appels entrants au service de pharmacie, évaluer l’urgence des appels, fournir les informations nécessaires à l’appelant, prendre les messages ou renvoyer l’appelant à la personne appropriée.
     Assurer la liaison avec le personnel et coordonner la récupération des réponses internes pour les questions nécessitant une réponse.
     Se tenir constamment au courant des activités du service afin d’interpréter et de diriger les demandes d’élimination et de renseignements, ainsi que les directives émanant d’autres services et du public, en fournissant de l’aide et les renseignements requis, verbalement ou par écrit.
     Livrer les médicaments au sein du service de pharmacie, de la pharmacie pédiatrique (KidCare) et du service clinique de manière opportune et appropriée.
     Apporter son soutien au personnel de la pharmacie pour les tâches pharmaceutiques non réglementées.
     Numériser tous les dossiers papier au dossier du patient.
     Tenir à jour les dossiers et commander les fournitures nécessaires dans les secteurs du service.
     Photocopier, assembler, télécopier et distribuer des documents. Corriger les erreurs de grammaire et d’orthographe qui se glissent dans les documents.
     Dactylographier, transcrire la correspondance dictée et formater sous forme électronique des rapports et de la correspondance, préparer des feuilles de calcul, préparer des documents aux fins d’examen.
     Analyser et classer par ordre de priorité le courrier et les documents entrants, et les distribuer de manière appropriée.
     Établir, développer et maintenir divers systèmes internes de soutien de bureau, tels que des bases de données électroniques, des systèmes de suivi, des systèmes de classement, des rapports mensuels, des systèmes de rappel et des dossiers confidentiels.
     Participer aux réunions du personnel et des techniciens en pharmacie, aux activités de planification et de communication du service et aux missions de projets spéciaux, au besoin.
     Participer aux activités d’assurance qualité de la pharmacie.
     Maintenir les aires de travail propres, organisées et fonctionnelles.
     Travailler en collaboration avec tous les collègues en favorisant et en maintenant des relations harmonieuses entre les services et au sein des services.
     Effectuer les autres tâches, telles qu’elles sont attribuées.
   
   
   
     QUALIFICATIONS
   
   
     Vérification du casier judiciaire (Essentiel)
     Diplôme de fin d’études secondaires (Essentiel)
     Expérience pertinente d’au moins six (6) mois (Essentiel)
     Connaissance pratique de logiciels de traitement de texte, de calcul, de présentation, de courrier électronique (Essentiel)
     Utilisation d’un système de messagerie vocale, d’un photocopieur et d’un télécopieur complexe (Essentiel)
     Adaptation de ses priorités afin de terminer ses tâches dans les délais requis (Essentiel)
     Adaptation aux changements afin d’accomplir les tâches requises (Essentiel)
     Capacité à communiquer avec efficacité et concision, verbalement et par écrit (Essentiel)
     Capacité à travailler en autonomie (Essentiel)
     Recherche, collecte, analyse et/ou résumé d’informations (Essentiel)
     Capacité à traiter efficacement avec la clientèle interne et externe (Essentiel)
     Faire preuve de discernement, de discrétion et d’un haut degré de confidentialité (Essentiel)
     Bilinguisme (anglais et français) (Souhaitable)
   
   
   
    Veuillez noter que vous serez représenté(e) par le syndicat de la Fédération Ontarienne des travailleurs de la santé, LIUNA Local 1110.

Eaton’s Electrical Engineering and Services Division is hiring a Power Systems Engineering Specialist (Expert) to join our team. This position will be located ideally out of our Milton, Ontario facility, but could also be located in one of our other Service centers throughout Canada.
 
  
   
     What you’ll do: 
   
   
     The primary purpose of this position is to provide power systems expertise and applied engineering. The subject matter expert will provide technical consultation for customers in the areas of power systems studies, power quality analysis, substation design and training.  Eaton's Electrical Services & Systems team offers a comprehensive portfolio of services tailored for every stage of a power system’s life cycle—whether it’s design, build, or support. Our services integrate and optimize the elements of a power system to make sure it’s aligned with business goals. We can help keep your power system safe, efficient, reliable, and up-to-date.
    
      Eaton has the largest and most experienced team of power system engineers in the industry, with industry-standard software and advanced modeling and analysis capabilities at their fingertips. This team brings extensive skills and experiences to power system analysis and design. Active participation in technical societies such as IEEE and collaboration with a variety of utilities and industries ensures that our engineers are knowledgeable about today’s cutting edge engineering techniques. We assist customers at every stage of the power system: from substation and distribution system design to renewable energy and smart grid engineering, from safety and reliability-focused studies to power quality and grounding related audits and analyses.
      
      
     In this function you will:
      
     
      Provide applied engineering and technical consultation for customers in the areas of power systems studies, power quality analysis, substation design and training.
      Self-management of assigned projects and job cost accountability to perform work within budgeted cost estimates.
      Interpret specs and customer inquiries and design technical proposals and pricing for customers
      Provide technical solutions to customers that may involve equipment design or upgrades, testing of equipment, solutions relating to increase safety, reliability, or efficiency
      Ability to run major studies and projects unassisted
      Mentor other engineers, as applicable
     
    
   
  
  
   
     Qualifications: 
   
   
    
      Basic (Required) Qualifications:
      
     
      Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering
      P.Eng. License
      Minimum of 8 years of work experience in the electrical industry
      Minimum of 5 years of work experience power systems
      Legally authorized to work in the Canada without company sponsorship
      
      
     Preferred Qualifications:
      
     
      Bachelor Degree focused in electrical power systems or PHD
      IEEE Senior Membership
      Active in Local IEEE
      Technical Paper Authorship
      Active in Standards Development
      Experience with protective relays is highly desirable
      Experience using Power System modelling packages like SKM, ETAP, EazyPower, CYME etc
      Advanced experience in multi-function protection relays setting files and logic files.
      Experience in the following areas:
      Short-Circuit Analysis, LV/MV Coordination
      Arc Flash studies and mitigations
      Ground grid design (sub stations)
      Experience in testing, troubleshooting, evaluating, and servicing electrical distribution and control systems is highly desirable
      Experience performing power quality measurements, troubleshooting, and analysis is highly desirable
      Power Quality Measurements and Analysis
      Harmonic Analysis
      PLC / Automation
      Alternate Energy
      Knowledge of engineering standards including CSA, NEC, NESC, IEEE and ANSI
      Design of Distribution System, Substation and Protection & Control
     
    
   
  
  
   
     Skills: 
   
   
    
     Customer Focus
     Problem Solving
     Action Oriented

In addition, they will administer human resources policies and procedures, collects, and analyzes HR data and then makes recommendations to management and processes paperwork for functional area according to established procedures. 

 
Responsibilities:
 
 
 Serve as an HR relationship conduit for assigned businesses by proactively developing effective manager/employee relationships. 
 Acts as the single point of contact for all employees and mangers for the delivery of effective Global and local HR programs and services

 Lead full cycle recruitment process and work with leaders to ensure proper onboarding & orientation process.

 Provide management reports as required. 
 Perform other related duties as assigned or requested by senior management 
 Qualifications 

 
 7 years related experience, including professional level experience in all areas of Human Resources. 
 Degree or diploma in Business with Human Resources coursework or equivalent; Certified Human Resources Professional designation or equivalent preferred 
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to identify and implement effective solutions within established policies and identify and recommend potential policy amendments. 
 Strong organizational skills: ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks. 
 Previous experience working on FCP (Federal Contractors Program) and Pay Equity Plans is required. 
 A sound knowledge of general human resources principles and practices. 
 Exceptional relationship-building skills, including the ability to develop, maintain, and strengthen partnerships with internal and external stakeholders. 
 Demonstrated ability to get results through others – to influence without authority. 
 Must have a demonstrated strong customer service orientation in order to provide exceptional service and continuous improvement on meeting and exceeding customer expectations . 
 Effective change management skills. 
 Strong consultation, coaching and negotiating skills. 
 Excellent communication skills are required, including the abilities to listen, understand, write clearly and concisely, and demonstrate effective verbal delivery. 
 Eligible for a Security Clearance is required.

Position Description : 
  Working in a fast paced, team based multi-disciplined environment, while collaborating with others and supporting the navy, coast guard, and commercial customer, Serco has a great opportunity for you!
  This position is contingent upon award of contract.
  The Junior Naval Architect receives technical guidance and training from the more experienced technical staff to which the individual is assigned and applies basic knowledge of naval architecture to perform routine analyses and prepare basic naval architectural deliverables in support of the design of ships, craft, and other floating structures.
  You will be part of a member team working with more experienced naval architects for a Ship Design Manager or Engineering Manager designing ships, or ship systems and working closely with the customer and other Serco teams.
  In this role, you will:
 
   Apply basic naval architectural knowledge in accordance with applicable regulatory body rules, regulations, and industry standards to develop analyses and products in one or more technical areas:
   Participates in the development and validation of design and engineering requirements, preparation of specifications, and provides inputs to technical reports and presentations. Provide hull form and hydrodynamic performance, including development of hull form geometry and lines plans, hydrostatics and curves of form, resistance and powering estimates, propulsor design and performance, appendage design, maneuvering analyses, seakeeping analyses, development of model test plans and observing and analyzing data from model tests or full-scale trials
   Participate in providing weight and stability analyses, including development of weight and center of gravity estimates, performance of intact and damaged stability analyses, performance of deadweight surveys and inclining experiments
   Participate in providing concept and feasibility design studies addressing whole ship sizing and performance analyses, requirements validation, and design optimization
   Participate in performing design integration, coordinating inputs from various naval architectural and other engineering disciplines, such as marine engineering and structures, into balanced, closed
   solution designs to establish principal characteristics and design features such as length, beam, depth, draft, displacement, speed, and other performance parameters
   Participate in performing structural design, developing hull girder bending moments and structural configurations and scantlings in accordance with appropriate rules or design standards, development of superstructure, mast, and local support structure to withstand primary and secondary loads
   Make general arrangements and configuration, developing requirements for area and volume, preparing overall ship arrangement concepts and drawings illustrating primary functional allocation of spaces within the ship considering location and adjacency constraints, performing special studies including access and line of sight analyses, assisting in detailed layouts of individual compartments such as living and berthing spaces, ship support spaces, storerooms, and shops.
   Assists with the review of design proposals and specifications.
   Participate in scheduled project review sessions and meetings with representatives from other engineering disciplines and customers on technical and engineering issues. 
  Assists in preparing documentation, reports, and project plans to describe activities planned and accomplished, status reports, letters, memoranda, messages, and contact reports.
   Assist with preparation and presentation of formal briefings and staff seminars
   Complies with all corporate policies and procedures, including quality assurance and security procedures, in the performance of duties.
  Qualifications : 
  To be successful in this role, you will have:
 
   A Bachelor’s degree in Naval Architecture or related engineering field such as Ocean Engineering, or equivalent in training and a minimum of 0-2 years of relevant experience. (In some cases, educational requirements may be adjusted or waived for more than 3 years applicable work experience.
   Must have valid Canadian work authorization / visa to be considered. 
  Must have the basic naval architectural knowledge in accordance with applicable regulatory body rules, regulations, and industry standards to develop analyses and products in one or more technical areas.
   Travel up to 10% may be required.
 
  Additional desired experience and skills:
 
   Possessing a Professional Engineer’s designation is considered an asset.
 
 
   **Serco Inc. is using this posting for the purpose of responding to a proposal. We are seeking qualified candidates in the event of a contract award. This position is not currently funded/active. Should Serco be awarded the contract, and you meet the qualifications of the position, you will be considered in the selection process. **
 
 
  If you are interested in supporting and working with a diverse and passionate Serco team- then submit your application now for immediate consideration. It only takes a few minutes and could change your career! Company Overview :

positionName: Pharmacy Technician, Pharmacy – Permanent Full Time (1.0) / Techniciens et techniciennes en pharmacie, Pharmacie - Permanent à temps plein (1,0)
description:
Compensation Pay Range:
  $31.09-$37.77
 
 
   Job Description:
 
 
   Please Note: If you are a current CHEO employee with access to Workday, please apply to this posting via the Workday application as an internal applicant.
 
 
 
   To successfully apply for this position, please submit your application by 11:59 pm the day before the advertised closing date in the posting to ensure your application is received.
 
 
 
   POSITION SUMMARY
 
 
   The Pharmacy Department at CHEO operates 24 hours daily, 7 days a week. Pharmacy technicians are expected to work day, evening, weekend and night shifts.
 
 
 
   JOB DESCRIPTION
 
 
   Under a pharmacist’s supervision the Pharmacy Technician:
 
 
   Performs all the tasks defined in the NAPRA Standards Practice for Pharmacy Technician practice from the Ontario College of Pharmacists (OCP).
   Keep up to date and follows workflow processes of the pharmacy department and the Hospital based on pharmacy standards and regulatory requirements
   Maintains accurate computerized patient profiles
   Dispenses, verify and deliver inpatient and outpatient prescriptions
   Distributes and maintains inventory of all pharmaceuticals, i.e. formulary, non-formulary, controlled substances, SAP, drug studies.
   Maintains stock of pharmaceuticals, labels, containers, and other supplies within the pharmacy work areas
   Records and reports any shortages of pharmaceuticals or supplies on the appropriate order list and to the pharmacy buyer
   Maintains stock of pharmaceuticals and supplies on the clinical wards and ambulatory clinics as required
   Maintains non-expired pharmaceuticals availability and participation in the rotation of stocks in the pharmacy and on the clinical wards and ambulatory clinics.
   Prioritize, initiate and complete the Patients Best Possible Medication History and highlight any discrepancies to the pharmacist
   Keeps work areas clean, organized, and functional
   Maintains equipment and automation in good working condition, problem solves as appropriate and reports issues to appropriate pharmacy personnel
   Reports product defects, i.e. labelling issues, product discoloration or deterioration, precipitate, contamination, etc. to pharmacist and complete the incident report
   Reports medication errors to pharmacist and complete the incident report
   Maintains records of pharmacy related activities and participate in the statistical reports for the Pharmacy Department
   Participates in the pharmacy technician work rotation fulfilling the responsibilities and tasks of each assigned area including weekend and night shifts
   Participates in staff and pharmacy technician meetings, departmental planning and communication activities, and special project assignments as required
   Participates in the training and orientation of new personnel in technical aspects of the Pharmacy Department
   Participates in departmental quality assurance activities
   Works cooperatively with all colleagues, promoting and maintaining harmonious inter and intra departmental relationships
   Maintains professional conduct and standards in all aspects of his/her work and when interacting with hospital staff and the public
   Cover Kid Care Pharmacy as required
   Performs other duties as assigned
 
 
 
   QUALIFICATIONS
 
 
   Criminal Record Check (Essential)
   Graduate of an accredited college Pharmacy Technician Program (Essential)
   Licensed as a Pharmacy Technician with the Ontario College of Pharmacists (Essential)
   Minimum of two (2) years related experience (Preferred)
   Sterile compounding experience (Preferred)
   Non-sterile compounding experience (Preferred)
   Bilingual (English/French) (Preferred)
   Maintains competency on all equipment and automation (Essential)
   Maintains sterile and non-sterile certifications yearly (Essential)
 
 
 
  
   Please note you will be represented by the Ontario Public Service Employees Union (OPSEU).
  
 
 
 
  
    CHEO is committed to providing a safe environment for staff, patients, and visitors. Consistent with that commitment, all applicants must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to be considered for any staff or volunteer opportunities. Applicants are also strongly encouraged to receive their COVID-19 booster shots when eligible to protect against the spread of COVID-19. Upon hiring, presentation of government issued documentation confirming full vaccination must be provided, or presentation of supporting documentation of a valid medical contraindication or other reasonable consideration pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.
  
 
 
 
  
    Effective March 29, 2021, CHEO will conduct a more comprehensive pre-screening and evaluation process. This process may include more varied and multidimensional testing such as a written test, practical exam, or other assessment. All candidates who meet the essential and preferred qualifications may be tested. All OPSEU members shall be granted an interview upon passing the pre-screening. Pre-screening might include testing.
  
 
 
 
  
    CHEO values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process and welcome interest from all qualified applicants.
  
 
 
 
  
    Should you require accommodation during any phase in the recruitment process, please contact Human Resources at jobs@cheo.on.ca. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential and will be handled in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.
  
 
 
 
  
    We thank all those who apply, however, only those to be interviewed will be contacted.
  
 
 
 
   Veuillez noter : Si vous êtes un employé actuel de CHEO et que vous avez accès à Workday, veuillez postuler à cette offre par l’entremise de l’application Workday à titre de candidat interne.
 
 
 
   Pour postuler avec succès à ce poste, veuillez soumettre votre candidature avant 23 h 59 le jour précédant la date de clôture annoncée dans l’annonce afin de vous assurer que votre candidature sera bien reçue.
 
 
 
   RÉSUMÉ DES FONCTIONS
 
 
   Le Service de la pharmacie du CHEO ne s’arrête jamais. Les techniciens et techniciennes en pharmacie doivent accepter de travailler la journée, le soir, les weekends et la nuit.
 
 
 
   DESCRIPTION DES TÂCHES
 
 
   Le technicien ou la technicienne en pharmacie relève du pharmacien et accomplit les tâches suivantes :
 
 
   Exécuter toutes les tâches définies dans le Modèle de normes des techniciens en pharmacie du Canada de NAPRA et du Ontario College of Pharmacists (OCP).
   Se tenir informé et suivre les politiques et procédures du Département de pharmacie et de l’Hôpital basés sur les standards professionnels de la pharmacies et les réglementations en vigueuresTenir à jour le profil électronique exact de chaque patient.
   Préparer, vérifier et livrer les médicaments d’ordonnance aux patients hospitalisés et ambulatoires.
   § Distribuer tous les produits pharmaceutiques et tenir l’inventaire à jourincluant les médicaments qui figurent ou non au formulaire, les stupéfiants, substances ciblées et contrôllées, les médicaments d’urgence, les médicaments du Programme d’Accès Spéciale de Santé Canada, les médicaments d’essais cliniques.
   Maintenirdes stocks de produits pharmaceutiques, des étiquettes et desautres fournitures dans les lieux de travail du Département de pharmacie.
   Inscrire les produits et les fournitures pharmaceutiques manquants sur la liste de commande désignée et les signaler à le(la) technicien(ne) en pharmacie assignéeà l’approvisionnement.
   Approvisionner es stocks de produits pharmaceutiques et de fournitures dans les services cliniques et ambulatoires de l’Hôpital en fonction de leurs besoins.
   S’assurer que les produits pharmaceutiques disponibles à la pharmacie et sur les étages cliniques et ambulatoires sont non-expirés et participer à la rotation des stocks
   Prioriser, débuter et compléter les histoires médicamenteuses des patients et informer rapidement le pharmacien de toutes divergences pour que celui-ci puisse les réconcilier.
   Assurer la propreté, l’ordre et la fonctionnalité des lieux de travail.
   Tenir les équipements et les dispositifs automatiques en bon état de fonctionnement; résoudre les problèmes dans la mesure du possible et signaler les problèmes aux membres du personnel concernés.
   Signaler au pharmacien les défauts des produits tels que le mauvais étiquetage, la décoloration, la détérioration, les dépôts ou la contamination d’un produit et remplir le rapport d’incident
   Signaler les erreurs de médication au pharmacien et remplir le rapport d’incident
   Mettre à jour les dossiers d’activités liées à la pharmacie et participer à la compilation des statistiques du Département de Pharmacie
   Participer aux différents rôles des techniciens en pharmacie en assumant les responsabilités et en exécutant les tâches de chaque section, ce qui inclue la rotation des horaires et d quarts de weekend et de nuit.
   Participer aux réunions du personnel et des techniciens du Département de pharmacie, aux activités de planification et de communication du Département ainsi qu’à l’exécution de projets spéciaux au besoin.
   Participer à la formation et à l’orientation des nouveaux employés en leur montrant les aspects techniques du Département de pharmacie.
   Participer aux activités d’assurance de la qualité du Département.
   Collaborer avec tous les collègues afin de favoriser et d’entretenir des relations harmonieuses dans le Département de pharmacie et avec les autres services de l’Hôpital.
   Remplacer les collègues dans la pharmacie KidCare selon les besoins
   Accomplir d’autres tâches à la demande du superviseur.
 
 
 
   QUALIFICATIONS
 
 
   Vérification du casier judiciaire (Essentiel)
   Diplôme de technicien en pharmacie d’un collègue accrédité (Essentiel)
   Agrément de technicien en pharmacie de l’Ordre des pharmaciens de l’Ontario (Essentiel)
   Expérience pertinente d’au moins deux (2) ans (Préférable)
   Expérience de la préparation d’articles stériles (Préférable)
   Expérience de la préparation d’articles non stériles (Préférable)
   Bilinguisme (français et anglais) (Préférable)
   Maintenir à jour ses connaissances et assurer le bon fonctionnement de tous les équipements et de tous les dispositifs automatiques (Essentiel)
   Réussir la certification annuelle pour les préparations stériles et non-stériles (Essentiel)
 
 
 
  
   Veuillez noter que vous serez représenté(e) par le syndicat des employés de la fonction publique de l’Ontario (SEFPO).
  
 
 
 
  
    CHEO s’engage à offrir un environnement sécuritaire au personnel, aux patients et aux visiteurs. Conformément à cet engagement, tous les candidats doivent être entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 pour être considérés comme des candidats pour tout emploi de personnel ou de bénévole. Les candidats sont également fortement encouragés à recevoir leurs doses de rappel contre la COVID-19 lorsqu’ils sont admissibles pour éviter la propagation de COVID-19. Lors de l’embauche, la présentation de documents gouvernementaux confirmant la vaccination complète doit être fournie, ou la présentation de documents justificatifs d’une contre-indication médicale valide ou d’une autre considération raisonnable en vertu du Code des droits de la personne de l’Ontario.
    
    À partir du 29 mars 2021, CHEO mènera un processus de présélection et d'évaluation plus complet. Ce processus peut comprendre des tests plus variés et multidimensionnels tels qu'un test écrit, un examen pratique ou une autre évaluation. Tous les candidats qui satisfont aux qualifications essentielles et préférées peuvent être testés. Tous les membres de OPSEU serront accorder une entrevue après avoir passé la présélection. La présélection peut comprendre des tests.
  
 
 
 
  
    CHEO valorise la diversité et est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès. Nous nous sommes engagés à fournir un environnement de travail inclusif et sans obstacle, en commençant par le processus d’embauche et nous sommes heureux de recevoir des demandes provenant de tous les candidats qualifiés.
  
 
 
 
  
    Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation pendant une phase du processus de recrutement, veuillez communiquer avec les Ressources humaines à jobs@cheo.on.ca. Tous les renseignements reçus concernant les mesures d’adaptation resteront confidentiels et seront traités conformément à la Loi sur l’accessibilité pour les personnes handicapées de l’Ontario.
  
 
 
 
  
    Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui posent leur candidature; toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec celles qui seront convoquées à une entrevue.
  
 
 
 
   Please note you will be represented by the Ontario Public Service Employees Union (OPSEU).
 
 
 
   CHEO values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process and welcome interest from all qualified applicants.
 
 
 
   Should you require accommodation during any phase in the recruitment process, please contact Human Resources at jobs@cheo.on.ca. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential and will be handled in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.
 
 
 
   We thank all those who apply, however, only those to be interviewed will be contacted.

  January 19, 2024

We are Pomerleau. And you could be too.  At Pomerleau, we fully understand that our mission is not only to create infrastructure or erect buildings, but to build communities. As a leader in the construction industry for nearly 60 years, we always aim to make a positive impact on the lives of the people we serve across Canada.
  To do this, we do everything we can to listen to their needs, to never lose sight of the realities of tomorrow and to innovate in a more committed, more collaborative and more sustainable way. Together, this is how we redefine our practice - for the good of our profession and of future generations.
  About the Role
  We are looking to add a meticulous and experienced Quality Inspector to join our growing team! This role is ideal for someone who has a keen eye for detail and takes great pride in maintaining the highest quality standards throughout all project phases.
  This role will work directly on-site supporting one of our key projects with the Federal Government of Canada.
  The successful candidate must be able to obtain Security Clearance with the Government of Canada Contract Security Program.
  What YOU Will Do
  
 
   Inspection and Compliance: Conduct thorough inspections of the site, materials, and installations to ensure compliance with project specifications, building codes, and standards
   Quality Assurance: Monitor and evaluate construction processes, materials, and workmanship to maintain the highest quality standards
   Document Control: Create detailed inspection reports outlining findings, deficiencies, and recommendations for corrective actions along with maintaining updated and accurate records of inspections, tests, and approvals through the use of inspection and testing plans
   Client Management: Work closely with external clients as well as internal site teams and subcontractors to facilitate site inspections, visits, and project updates and address any quality-related issues
   Test and Analysis: Coordinate and oversee material testing, including concrete, steel, and other construction materials, working with 3rd party agencies and clients
   Training and Support: Provide training and guidance to on-site teams on quality standards, best practices and compliance requirements
 
 
  What YOU Will Bring
  
 
   2-3 years of experience working as a Quality Inspector in the construction industry, preferably on large-scale building and infrastructure projects
   Strong understanding of construction methods, materials, and building codes/regulations
   Strong experience in document management and detailed reporting
   Physical ability to conduct on-site inspections
   Knowledge of mechanical or multidisciplinary environments is considered a strong asset
   A passion for upholding the highest standards and building successful client relationships
   Must be able to obtain security clearance with the Government of Canada
 
 
  Why Choose Pomerleau
 
   Competitive salary
 
 
   4 weeks’ vacation
 
 
   Group insurance (including a health spending account!)
 
 
   Group RRSP
 
 
   Employer paid monthly public transit pass
 
 
   Fitness Membership or Activity Reimbursement
 
 
   Employee assistance program
 
 
   Exciting training opportunities
 
 
   Dynamic culture
 
 
   Exciting career opportunities
 
 
   Summer hours all year long
 
 
   Access to telemedicine platform Dialogue for free
 
 
   New remote work policy
 
 
  What are you waiting for? Let's build something extraordinary together. Apply now to join the team. We want to hear from you!  We thank all applicants, but only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. Be sure to join our Talent Network to stay informed about all job opportunities at Pomerleau.  Pomerleau Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. During any stage of the recruitment and hiring process, accommodation for applicants with disabilities are available upon request.
